intro: Solanum stoloniferum var. pumilum, commonly known as the dwarf nightshade, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the southeastern United States. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring hairy, oval-shaped leaves and small, clustered white flowers that bloom in summer. The plant produces berries that start green and ripen to a dark purple or black color, containing toxic alkaloids. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges and disturbed habitats. Its botanical characteristics make it a notable species in ecological studies and horticultural research.
